title: Beginner English 107
headline: This free online English course covers word stress, verbs, adverbs of frequency and vocabulary relating to activities.
description: If you struggle to find words to stress in English sentences, this introductory English speaking course explains all you need to know regarding sentence rhythm. We study various grammar and spelling rules and show you how to compare present simple and third-person singular tense. We explain ‘wh’ questions to help you ask for information and go over verbs and adverbs of frequency. Finally, we provide vocabulary relating to activities and chores.
courseDescription:
This introductory English grammar course will help you develop your English pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary and aims to help you become more confident and proficient in this international language. We first demonstrate the pronunciation of words related to activities and chores. Then, since reading sentences with the proper tone and adding emphasis to words correctly when reading can change how sentences are received, we will teach you which words should be stressed to help you sound like a native English speaker.

The course then tackles specific grammar rules and explains the present simple use of regular and irregular verbs. We demonstrate how to ask questions using 'wh'-words before discussing the six adverbs of frequency, including 'always,' 'sometimes,' and 'never,' which describe how often an action occurs.

Our final topic aims to develop your vocabulary. We teach you to combine objects and verbs related to activities or chores to form phrases such as 'play music' or 'clean dishes.' This course will suit anyone who wants to improve their English pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary. We use visual images, audio links, and video tools to guide you through this process as you gain confidence in English. Sign up to open new windows of opportunity as you enhance your English skills with this course.
